answers.answer: Possible causes include a chemical imbalance, diabetes, a diet with high carbohydrate intake.You could try eating more vegetables and fruit. Don't drink fruit juice - eat the whole fruit as juice is too high in sugar.If the condition does not go away or the scent gets stronger, you should see your doctor and have some labs drawn.

question: Im only 16 and I already have DDs as if that wasn't a problem enough I get a lot of boob sweat, my friends all thought I was crazy when I said it smelt like vinegar but ive been researching and aparantly im not. but my problem is that all the posts ive seen are people experiencing this in the summer. I experience it all year round. I shower and wash my bras frequently. but I don't know how to get rid of the smell...help?
title: boob sweat
